text: Hi <@UNWHHSWHJ> thanks for the reply. I might be misspeaking but here's what I need to do. I need to set the value of `'coupon'`  to the variable value `couponCode` shown in the script.
The way I have it here, when I try to render the coupon value as a data attribute, nothing renders for the value of `data-coupon` in the HTML
<@U01PE6SAVFB> Hubl is server side, it executes before JS. You canâ€™t assign a JS value to a Hubl value.
<@U2H1Q3F8R> thanks for the tip. Any ideas for alternatives to pass that value to `coupon` in the example I posted?

Basically, what I need to do is when someone goes to <http://mysite.com/coupon=COUPONCODE|mysite.com/coupon=COUPONCODE> I need to grab whatever COUPONCODE is and pass it to that `coupon` value in the example.

I would check out using HubL to get the querystring - You can use {{request.query}} but check out the docs for use cases. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#http-request-variables>
As Reg said, request.query or querydict is the way to go here

<@U2H1Q3F8R> <@U26BLKGE4> I think I got it sorted out with

```{% set path = request.query %}

{% set couponString = path|split('coupon=','2')|last %}

{% set myPlatform = [
  {
    'name': 'UNIVERSAL macOS/WINDOWS',
    'platform': 'Universal',
    'description': 'License works on macOS or Windows',
    'paddleProductId': 12345,
    'coupon': '{{couponString}}'
  },```

Does anyone know of any solutions like <http://prerender.io|prerender.io> to use with HubSpot CMS and <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate|React> to build react based websites that perform well from an SEO perspective?
